distribution.text: Copyright Â© Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

notes.text:
An update for rh-ruby22-ruby is now available for Red Hat Software Collections.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Ruby is an extensible, interpreted, object-oriented, scripting language. It has features to process text files and to perform system management tasks.

The following packages have been upgraded to a later upstream version: rh-ruby22-ruby (2.2.9), rh-ruby22-rubygems (2.4.5.4), rh-ruby22-rubygem-psych (2.0.8.1), rh-ruby22-rubygem-json (1.8.1.1). (BZ#1549646)

Security Fix(es):

* ruby: Command injection vulnerability in Net::FTP (CVE-2017-17405)

* ruby: Buffer underrun vulnerability in Kernel.sprintf (CVE-2017-0898)

* rubygems: Arbitrary file overwrite due to incorrect validation of specification name (CVE-2017-0901)

* rubygems: DNS hijacking vulnerability (CVE-2017-0902)

* rubygems: Unsafe object deserialization through YAML formatted gem specifications (CVE-2017-0903)

* ruby: Escape sequence injection vulnerability in the Basic authentication of WEBrick (CVE-2017-10784)

* ruby: Buffer underrun in OpenSSL ASN1 decode (CVE-2017-14033)

* ruby: DL::dlopen could open a library with tainted library name (CVE-2009-5147, CVE-2015-7551)

* rubygems: Escape sequence in the "summary" field of gemspec (CVE-2017-0899)

* rubygems: No size limit in summary length of gem spec (CVE-2017-0900)

* ruby: Arbitrary heap exposure during a JSON.generate call (CVE-2017-14064)

* ruby: Command injection in lib/resolv.rb:lazy_initialize() allows arbitrary code execution (CVE-2017-17790)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

notes.text: DL::dlopen in Ruby 1.8, 1.9.0, 1.9.2, 1.9.3, 2.0.0 before patchlevel 648, and 2.1 before 2.1.8 opens libraries with tainted names.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: ruby: DL:: dlopen could open a library with tainted library name
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
Red Hat Product Security has rated this issue as having Low security
impact. This issue is not currently planned to be addressed in future updates. 

For additional information, refer to the Issue Severity Classification:
https://access.redhat.com/security/updates/classification/.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: ruby: DL:: dlopen could open a library with tainted library name

notes.text: The Fiddle::Handle implementation in ext/fiddle/handle.c in Ruby before 2.0.0-p648, 2.1 before 2.1.8, and 2.2 before 2.2.4, as distributed in Apple OS X before 10.11.4 and other products, mishandles tainting, which allows context-dependent attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (application crash) via a crafted string, related to the DL module and the libffi library.  NOTE: this vulnerability exists because of a CVE-2009-5147 regression.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: ruby: DL:: dlopen could open a library with tainted library name
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
Red Hat Product Security has rated this issue as having Low security
impact. This issue is not currently planned to be addressed in future updates. 

For additional information, refer to the Issue Severity Classification:
https://access.redhat.com/security/updates/classification/.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

vulnerabilities.title: ruby: DL:: dlopen could open a library with tainted library name

notes.text: A buffer underflow was found in ruby's sprintf function. An attacker, with ability to control its format string parameter, could send a specially crafted string that would disclose heap memory or crash the interpreter.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: ruby: Buffer underrun vulnerability in Kernel.sprintf
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This issue affects the versions of ruby as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 and the versions of rh-ruby22-ruby and rh-ruby23-ruby as shipped with Red Hat Software Collections. Red Hat Product Security has rated this issue as having Moderate security impact. A future update may address this issue. For additional information, refer to the Issue Severity Classification: https://access.redhat.com/security/updates/classification/.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

vulnerabilities.title: ruby: Buffer underrun vulnerability in Kernel.sprintf

notes.text: A vulnerability was found where rubygems did not properly sanitize gems' specification text. A specially crafted gem could interact with the terminal via the use of escape sequences.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: rubygems: Escape sequence in the "summary" field of gemspec
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This issue affects the versions of ruby as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6, and 7 and the versions of rh-ruby22-ruby and rh-ruby23-ruby as shipped with Red Hat Software Collections. Red Hat Product Security has rated this issue as having Low security impact. A future update may address this issue. For additional information, refer to the Issue Severity Classification: https://access.redhat.com/security/updates/classification/.

vulnerabilities.title: rubygems: Escape sequence in the "summary" field of gemspec

notes.text: It was found that rubygems could use an excessive amount of CPU while parsing a sufficiently long gem summary. A specially crafted gem from a gem repository could freeze gem commands attempting to parse its summary.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: rubygems: No size limit in summary length of gem spec
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This issue affects the versions of ruby as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6, and 7 and the versions of rh-ruby22-ruby and rh-ruby23-ruby as shipped with Red Hat Software Collections. Red Hat Product Security has rated this issue as having Low security impact. A future update may address this issue. For additional information, refer to the Issue Severity Classification: https://access.redhat.com/security/updates/classification/.

vulnerabilities.title: rubygems: No size limit in summary length of gem spec

notes.text: It was found that rubygems did not sanitize gem names during installation of a given gem. A specially crafted gem could use this flaw to install files outside of the regular directory.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: rubygems: Arbitrary file overwrite due to incorrect validation of specification name
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This issue affects the versions of ruby as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6, and 7 and the versions of rh-ruby22-ruby and rh-ruby23-ruby as shipped with Red Hat Software Collections. Red Hat Product Security has rated this issue as having Moderate security impact. A future update may address this issue. For additional information, refer to the Issue Severity Classification: https://access.redhat.com/security/updates/classification/.

notes.text: A vulnerability was found where rubygems did not sanitize DNS responses when requesting the hostname of the rubygems server for a domain, via a _rubygems._tcp DNS SRV query. An attacker with the ability to manipulate DNS responses could direct the gem command towards a different domain.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: rubygems: DNS hijacking vulnerability
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This issue affects the versions of ruby as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6, and 7 and the versions of rh-ruby22-ruby and rh-ruby23-ruby as shipped with Red Hat Software Collections. Red Hat Product Security has rated this issue as having Moderate security impact. A future update may address this issue. For additional information, refer to the Issue Severity Classification: https://access.redhat.com/security/updates/classification/.

notes.text: A vulnerability was found where the rubygems module was vulnerable to an unsafe YAML deserialization when inspecting a gem. Applications inspecting gem files without installing them can be tricked to execute arbitrary code in the context of the ruby interpreter.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: rubygems: Unsafe object deserialization through YAML formatted gem specifications
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
This issue did not affect the versions of rubygems as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 6.

This issue affects the versions of ruby as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 and the versions of rh-ruby22-ruby and rh-ruby23-ruby as shipped with Red Hat Software Collections. Red Hat Product Security has rated this issue as having Moderate security impact. A future update may address this issue. For additional information, refer to the Issue Severity Classification: https://access.redhat.com/security/updates/classification/.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.

vulnerabilities.title: rubygems: Unsafe object deserialization through YAML formatted gem specifications

notes.text: It was found that WEBrick did not sanitize all its log messages. If logs were printed in a terminal, an attacker could interact with the terminal via the use of escape sequences.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: ruby: Escape sequence injection vulnerability in the Basic authentication of WEBrick
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This issue affects the versions of ruby as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5, 6, and 7, as well as the versions of rh-ruby22-ruby and  rh-ruby23-ruby as shipped with Red Hat Software Collections 3. Red Hat Product Security has rated this issue as having Moderate security impact. A future update may address this issue. For additional information, refer to the Issue Severity Classification: https://access.redhat.com/security/updates/classification/.

cwe.name: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer

notes.text: It was found that the decode method of the OpenSSL::ASN1 module was vulnerable to buffer underrun. An attacker could pass a specially crafted string to the application in order to crash the ruby interpreter, causing a denial of service.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: ruby: Buffer underrun in OpenSSL ASN1 decode
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
This issue did not affect the versions of ruby as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5 and 6, and the versions of rh-ruby24-ruby.

This issue affects the versions of ruby as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7 and the versions of rh-ruby22-ruby and rh-ruby23-ruby as shipped with Red Hat Software Collections 3. Red Hat Product Security has rated this issue as having Moderate security impact. A future update may address this issue. For additional information, refer to the Issue Severity Classification: https://access.redhat.com/security/updates/classification/.
notes.title: Statement

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

vulnerabilities.title: ruby: Buffer underrun in OpenSSL ASN1 decode

cwe.name: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor

notes.text: A buffer overflow vulnerability was found in the JSON extension of ruby. An attacker with the ability to pass a specially crafted JSON input to the extension could use this flaw to expose the interpreter's heap memory.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: ruby: Arbitrary heap exposure during a JSON.generate call
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text:
This issue did not affect the versions of ruby as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5, and 6. These versions do not include the JSON module.

This issue affects the versions of ruby as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7, as well as the versions of rh-ruby22-ruby and rh-ruby23-ruby as shipped with Red Hat Software Collections. Red Hat Product Security has rated this issue as having Low security impact. A future update may address this issue. For additional information, refer to the Issue Severity Classification: https://access.redhat.com/security/updates/classification/.
notes.title: Statement

vulnerabilities.title: ruby: Arbitrary heap exposure during a JSON.generate call

notes.text: It was discovered that the Net::FTP module did not properly process filenames in combination with certain operations. A remote attacker could exploit this flaw to execute arbitrary commands by setting up a malicious FTP server and tricking a user or Ruby application into downloading files with specially crafted names using the Net::FTP module.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: ruby: Command injection vulnerability in Net::FTP
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This issue affects the versions of ruby as shipped with Red Hat Subscription Asset Manager 1 and CloudForms 5. Red Hat Product Security has rated this issue as having Moderate security impact. A future update may address this issue. For additional information, refer to the Issue Severity Classification: https://access.redhat.com/security/updates/classification/.

vulnerabilities.title: ruby: Command injection vulnerability in Net::FTP

cwe.name: Improper Neutralization of Special Elements used in a Command ('Command Injection')

notes.text: The "lazy_initialize" function in lib/resolv.rb did not properly process certain filenames. A remote attacker could possibly exploit this flaw to inject and execute arbitrary commands.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: ruby: Command injection in lib/resolv.rb:lazy_initialize() allows arbitrary code execution
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

notes.text: This issue affects the versions of ruby as shipped with Red Hat Enterprise Linux 5, 6 and 7. Red Hat Product Security has rated this issue as having Low security impact. A future update may address this issue. For additional information, refer to the Issue Severity Classification: https://access.redhat.com/security/updates/classification/.
